txt.en: If the Northcotton Farm is to have a market, a lot will need to be cleaned up.

'The market-grounds are mostly ready, but there's another thing we must do first. There will be many small hobbit-children who come to the market, and they love to wander the farm.

'The thing they like seeing most, after the animals, are the scarecrows in the field. I haven't had time to put them out yet this year.

'You can find the scarecrows behind a farm-house to the east. If you could gather them up and place them in the fields, the children would be delighted.'
The scarecrows are behind a farm-house to the east.\n\nThe scarecrows must be collected before they can be placed in the fields.
'The children will love seeing the scarecrows. It gives them a happy little fright!'
The scarecrows should be placed in the fields around the Northcotton Farm.\n\nThe hobbit-children will delight in seeing the scarecrows in the fields.
Milo Longfurrow is at the Northcotton Farm.\n\nMilo Longfurrow will be pleased to hear that the scarecrows are placed.
'Good! Now get the scarecrows placed out in the fields.'
'You'll have to gather up the scarecrows before you plant them in the fields.'
Plant the scarecrows in the fields ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Planted the scarecrows in the fields ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
